bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 167, Number 110 (Thursday, June 24, 2021)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. WITTMAN:H.R. 4167.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:United States of America Constitution:Article I, Section 8, Clause 3[Page H3135]

item.title: Northern Neck National Heritage Area Act

latestAction.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources Subcommittee on National Parks. Hearings held.

item.name: National Parks, Forests, and Public Lands Subcommittee

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks, Forests, and Public Lands.
Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.

summary.text:
Northern Neck National Heritage Area Act

This bill establishes the Northern Neck National Heritage Area in Virginia.

The bill includes in the heritage area land between the Potomac River and Rappahannock River of the eastern coastal region of Virginia, including King George, Lancaster, Northumberland, Richmond, and Westmoreland Counties.

The bill designates the Northern Neck Tourism Commission, a working committee of the Northern Neck Planning District Commission, as the local coordinating entity for the heritage area.

The Northern Neck Tourism Commission shall submit a proposed management plan for the heritage area to the Department of the Interior for approval.

bill.title: Northern Neck National Heritage Area Act

item.title: To establish the Northern Neck National Heritage Area, and for other purposes.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
